Package com.group26.node.packet

Class PacketSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.group26.node.packet.PacketSender
  • public final class PacketSender
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that is used to send messages to the nearest nodes in the network. It provides a possibility to send messages reliably, by waiting for the corresponding ack. Also, a message can be sent repeatably, within a given timeout, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static PacketSender getInstance()
        Returns:
        instance of the packet sender

      • sendReliablePacketAndWait

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Byte> sendReliablePacketAndWait​(NetworkPacket packet,
                                                               int minDelay,
                                                               int maxDelay,
                                                               int attempts,
                                                               int timeout,
                                                               java.util.Set<java.lang.Byte> expectingAcks)
        Sends a packet with reliability assurance and waits for the receiver acks to arrive. If there are missing acks within the given timeout, then retransmit the packet until there are no more attempts.
        Parameters:
        packet - sending packet
        maxDelay - delay within which the packet should be sent
        attempts - retransmission attempts
        timeout - timeout after which to retransmit
        expectingAcks - receiver ids that should send an ack
        Returns:
        ids of nodes that did not send an ack

      • sendReliableMessage

        public void sendReliableMessage​(NetworkPacket packet,
                                int minDelay,
                                int maxDelay,
                                int attempts,
                                int timeout,
                                java.util.Set<java.lang.Byte> expectingAcks)
        Sends a packet with reliability assurance and waits for acks to arrive in a separate thread. If there are missing acks, then the packet is retransmitted until there are no more attempts.
        Parameters:
        packet - sending packet
        maxDelay - max delay within which the packet should be sent
        attempts - retransmission attempts
        timeout - timeout after which to retransmit
        expectingAcks - receiver ids that should send an ack

      • scheduleMessage

        public void scheduleMessage​(Message message,
                            long from,
                            long to)
        Schedules sending a safe message between the given values.
        Parameters:
        message - sending message
        from - lower time limit
        to - upper time limit

      • repeatSendMessage

        public void repeatSendMessage​(Message message,
                              long delay,
                              int times)
        Repeats sending a message with a given delay.
        Parameters:
        message - sending message
        delay - delay between sending messages
        times - the number of times that a message is being sent

      • sendSafeMessage

        public void sendSafeMessage​(Message message,
                            long delay)
        Sends a message by using a collision avoidance technique. The node waits until the network is free, then waits a given delay and sends a message if the network is still free.
        Parameters:
        message - sending message
        delay - period after which a node sends a ping packet

      • finishSending

        public void finishSending()
        Handles finishing sending a message.

      • setNetworkState

        public void setNetworkState​(boolean isBusy)
        Changes the network state depending on whether there is any activity in the network.
        Parameters:
        isBusy - true if the network is busy

      • getQueue

        public java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> getQueue()
        Returns:
        sending queue
